Author: shark_robinson
Text: Sounds like it might be rumination syndrome. There are breathing techniques that can help you relearn how to keep food down, and I think there are even treatment programs for it.

Author: lavendermyth
Text: This is definitely not unheard of. It can be made worse by anxiety and your stomach can also involuntarily contract. In my case it's a weakened esophageal sphincter--the muscle that keeps your esophagus closed off from your stomach. I can't bend over or lay down immediately after having liquids or else it will just come back up. I didn't purge at all for a few years and even after relapsing last year only purged occasionally (I have stomach issues and am under strict orders from my GI NOT to purge because it keeps causing stomach bleeding lol) and it still happens.   If it keeps happening and you are able to I would bring it up with a doctor at some point just to be safe; they might have a better idea of why exactly it's still happening and be able to tell you if it's any cause for concern.
